issues.title: jdbcapi/checkDataSource.java and  jdbapi/checkDataSource30.java to tests should be changed or extended to test client DataSources
Protocol exception when Network Server tries to return ~32K of data or greater in a result set for a Java stored procedure.
Update documentation for DERBY-470
Add jdk14 suite to network server tests
Handle pushing IN predicates into UNIONs. This would allow use of index if present improving performance.
Push join predicates into union and other set operations. DERBY-649 implemented scalar (single table) predicate pushdown. Adding join predicate push down could improve performance significantly.
Prevent unneeded object creation and excessive decoding in parsePKGNAMCSN()
writeSQLCAGRP() should use byte[] constants instead of Strings where feasible
Modify derbynet/testProperties.java test to run with 10.1client/10.2 server
Reset optimizer timeout for subqueries on a per-round basis to allow consideration of plans that use pushed predicates.
Change the client driver to allow statements to be garbage-collected once they are not referenced in an application
DRDA Protocol Exception when DSS is exactly 32767 in length
Bug in NULLIF Function
LIKE handles strings with control characters incorrectly.
Cannot create CHAR column with size greater than 254
Stored procedure cannot be invoked with VALUES statement
NPE when creating a trigger on a table and default schema doesn't exist.
Network Server can send DSS greater than 32K to client, which breaks DRDA protocol.
Inserting large string value into non-existent table causes communication link failure over Network Server.
rollforward will not work correctly  if the system happens to crash immediately after rollforward backup.
AES encryption test fails on Solaris 10
create table fails when a constraint defintion follows a column default
SimpleNetworkClientSample.java network server example has an error which causes it to fail
Server-side "trace on" and "trace off" commands do not appear to be working correctly.
SYNONYM should not be allowed in SESSION schema because that can confusion wih temporary tables
SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COMPRESS_TABLE  does not work  on tables that are created with delimited identifier names.
Successive writes to a java.sql.Blob.setBinaryStream(long) seem to reset the file pointer
Distinct in subselect can return wrong results
test blobclob4BLOB fails on OS 390
networkserver does not return error message strings in native encoding to ij on zseries
Execution failed because of a Distributed Protocol Error
create index can fail under the SecurityManager when trying to access files in the tmp folder of a database
Make the client driver connection URL work when spaces are in the URL.
setNull() using Types.VARCHAR for a CLOB parameter fails in embedded mode.
Useful indexes not used in UNION ALL
Hyperlinks in demo/demo.html are broken
Documentation and demos have incubator references
Release archives should have executable bits set for scripts and text files should have proper line endings.
test harness improvements required for running on non-ASCII systems
derby documentation does not reflect changes to update lock behavior
the lock compatibility table in developers guide needs to be updated
Use correct encoding for ClobOutputStream on client
Java 2 security policy file examples don't work -- are missing a needed line
Large page cache kills initial performance
lock deadlocks sometimes reported as lock timeouts
""  does not work as a userid for Derby client (SqlException: userid length, 0, is not allowed.)
row estimates from btree code can sometimes return more row than exist in table
NullPointerException when 'encryptionKey' length is an odd number, or it contains invalid chars
java.lang.NullPointerException can occur  while scanning for  global id  in the transaction table  under heavey load.
CachedPage.readPage() can loop forever on insane builds if  the read from the container keep failing with  IO Exceptions.
Hang in starting network server on Z/OS
'store/encryptionKey.sql' fails on Solaris 10
After calling ResultSet.relative(0) the cursor loses its position
NullPointerException booting if loaded by the bootstrap class loader and JVM returns null for bootstrap loader.
derbylang/ConcurrentImplicitCreateSchema.java fails intermittently with a lock timeout
PreparedStatements can take longer to execute than equivalent Statements when there are multiple join conditions mixed with some search clauses.
zOS - with DerbyClient getDate(#) fails with IllegalArgumentException - unsupported date format - resultset.java
Increasing size of varchar type using ALTER TABLE can implicitly change the column from NOT NULL to NULLable.
setAutoCommit(false) is not working properly for local transaction with ClientXADataSource
Cannot rollback to savepoint when using ClientXADataSource
Remove use of String(byte[]) and String(byte[], int, int) constructors in network client leading to non-portable behaviour
Remove use of String(byte[]) constructors in network server leading to non-portable behaviour
Remove use of String(byte[]) and String(byte[], int, int) constructors in engine leading to non-portable behaviour
Remove use of String(byte[]) and String(byte[], int, int) constructors in testing leading to non-portable behaviour
Client xa prepare returns XA_OK instead of  XA_RDONLY for a read only transaction
creating a preparedStatement outside of a Global tran using a ClientXADatasource  will result in an "SqlException: Cannot set holdability"  if the statement  is used in a Global transaction
tests derbynet/csPrepStmt and prepStmt use mechanisms that are not portable over encodings
SQL examples for LEFT OUTER JOIN and RIGHT OUTER JOIN in the Derby Reference manual are incorrect
jdbcapi/nullSQLText.java fails in J2ME in 10.1 branch
storetests/st_derby715.java fails in J2ME in 10.1 branch
ClassCastException when executing queries with aggregates in app servers
Check that DRDAStatement and DRDAResultSet states are reset when they are re-used
Client should not require user to rollback the active transaction before call to PooledConnection.getConnection()
getHoldability does not return CLOSE_CURSORS_AT_COMMIT in a global transaction
Client allows setHoldability to HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT  on both connection and statement in a global transaction
Optimizer can return incorrect "best cost" estimates with nested subqueries, which leads to generation of sub-optimal plans.
Embedded ResultSet.getStatement() does not return the Statement object that created it  for a connection returned from EmbeddedXADataSource
setTransactionIsolation can cause ava.sql.SQLException: Invalid operation: statement closed in some contexts with xa
Client's XAResource.start throws XAException with XAER_RMFAIL when local transaction is active
[xa] client XAResource.start() does not commit an active local transaction when auto commit is true
With client, Connection.getTransactionIsolation() return value is wrong after changing the isolation level with an SQL statement such as "set current isolation = RS"
[xa] client XAConnection.getConnection()  does not have the correct  default isolation level if set by an earlier connection obtained from the same XAConnection
Security.AccessControlException in client under SecurityManager when trying to connect using EUSRIDPWD security mechanism
derby fails supporting holdable scrollable resultset: ERROR XSCB8: The btree conglomerate 1,141,037,436,752 is closed.
Client should unwrap exceptions thrown in privilege blocks rather than throwing the java.security.PrivilegedActionException
java.lang.NullPointerException with char for bit data column  and subquery
lang/predicatePushdown.sql fails with wsdd5.6
client gives SqlException for test callable.java and parameterMapping.java on zOS
JDBC driver on rs.getFloat() gives LossOfPrecisionConversionException for float fields containing Float.MAX_VALUE
With client PooledConnection.getConnection() does not reset holdability and isolation state properly
Client XA getTransactionIsolation()   does not return the correct isolation level when rejoining a global transaction
PreparedStatement.executeUpdate throws a XJ05C exception in a global transaction if the statement is HOLD_CURSORS_OVER_COMMIT
NullPointerException in network server with LDAP authentication
defragment of inplace compress pass for described dataset is not freeing up empty pages.
latch self deadlock when running inplace compress

importExportThruIJ.sql supportfiles sqlAnywhere* need to be copied in fixed encoding

Need to remove old copyright notice

ASSERT failure/IndexOutOfBoundsException with correlated subquery for UPDATE ... SET ... WHERE CURRENT OF ... statement.
The object names in SQLException messages are not in UTF-16
